result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

10:59 AM Defendant Wesley J. Kobylarczyk in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Wesley J. Kobylarczyk.  Attorney Lawrencee Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin.   Information reviewed/waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY Plea to both counts.  Present bond cont'd.

records.addlTxt: Judge Conley's response to doc #20
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Wesley J. Kobylarczyk in court.  Attorney Jeffrey P Kippa in court for Wesley J. Kobylarczyk. VWC Rachael Race in court. State calls Investigator Ron Ripley who is sworn and testifies. Cross exam by Atty Kippa. Redirect by SP Luetscher. Recross by Atty Kippa. Witness excused. No other evidence. Based on the evidence heard the Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and defendant bound over to the circuit court. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Arraignment scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Arraignment on October 24, 2022 at 11:00 am.
